meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for living in.
meanings.sent1: The livabilities of the neighborhood include safety and access to amenities.
meanings.sent2: People consider the livabilities of a city before deciding to move there.
meanings.sent3: The real estate agent joked that the house's livabilities were so high, even the plants would thrive.
meanings.sent4: The livabilities of the town were like a warm embrace, welcoming all who came.
meanings.sent5: She painted a vivid picture of the livabilities of the countryside, describing it as a peaceful haven.

meanings.definition: The factors that make a place suitable or pleasant to live in.
meanings.sent1: Good schools and parks are important livabilities for families looking to settle down.
meanings.sent2: The livabilities of the coastal town attracted many retirees seeking a relaxing lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The quirky decorations added to the livabilities of the apartment, making it feel cozy and unique.
meanings.sent4: The livabilities of the mountain retreat were like a breath of fresh air, rejuvenating all who visited.
meanings.sent5: The brochure highlighted the livabilities of the resort, promising a luxurious and comfortable stay.
